properties.name: Tofoo Com Chay
properties.description: Posted by Coffywoman  388 E Santa Clara St, San Jose 95113 Cheap mock meat and tofu dishes. All vegan except for the occasional dairy-based dessert. Favorite dishes include: lemon chicken, lemongrass gluten, veggie drumsticks, black pepper sausage, basil eggplant, and their steamed vegetable buns.

properties.name: Zeni Ethiopian Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Coffywoman 1320 Saratoga Ave, San Jose, CAYummy Ethiopian food. Lots of vegan selections.

properties.name: fell off my bike riding along West Cliff
properties.description: Posted by Coffywoman This is the approximate location where I flew off my bike going about 18mph. I heard a "kachunk" sound and then I was over the handlebars and in the pavement. Luckily, a white Honda Civic driving behind me was able to stop before mowing me down! I had to go to the medical clinic to get my hip fixed up...the cut was so deep you could practically see bone. They couldn\'t do stitches because the cut was too wide, but they gave me burn ointment and a lot of gauze. I still have the scar....

properties.name: my first date with my love
properties.description: Posted by Coffywoman 1545 Pacific Ave, Santa Cruz, CAWe had coffee at a table out on the back patio of Lulu Carpenters while I suppressed my fear of the pigeons flapping all around us. He was reading Adbusters and he brought me Valhrona chocolate. We went for a walk along Walnut Avenue and he told me about his rollerblading mishap and his weekend plans to have dinner at Millenium in San Francisco. I knew immediately that I could marry this guy...and I did, 3 years later...!

properties.name: my li'l (former) shoebox
properties.description: Posted by Coffywoman Everson Drive, Santa Cruz, CACute, conveniently located near downtown and the beach. We\'d ride our bikes and run along West Cliff and I could walk 10 minutes to work. Reluctantly traded it in for the current abode. Well worth the trade -- since it isn\'t the best location for raising kids -- but I still sometimes miss it!

properties.name: where I work
properties.description: Posted by Coffywoman110 Cooper Street, Santa Cruz, CALightsurf/VeriSign

properties.name: where we got married
properties.description: Posted by Coffywoman1 Chaminade Lane, Santa Cruz, CAWe had a vegan wedding at the Chaminade co-officiated by our friend Heather and Rabbi Gershon. Chaminade was very accommodating and allowed us to bring in our own vegan cake from Black China Bakery and to pick out our appetizers and entrees. We gave them recipes from the Millennium cookbook which they prepared specially for the big shindig! Lucky for us, the weather gave us a break, too, and it didn\'t rain on the actual wedding day!
